column4: Anyone know if Screen Resoltion reads a file other than xorg.conf? Mine has a resolution that's not in my xorg.conf file, and I want to add a resolution...but it's not listing it in Screen Resolution when I add the value to xorg.conf.

Hey everyone. I'm just curious...even with graphical acceleration enabled, I still notice tearing and other visual glitches when I move, resize, and mess around with windows. Compared to an OS like OS X, where this never happens, can this be accomplished in Linux?
cool, so is Xgl sort of becoming the new standard for desktop compositing?
no not for people with good graphics cards. Is kinda like Vista, nice looking and all
XGL is on top of Ubuntu
okay, cool. Yeah, I suppose my GPU is slightly old.
yeah it probably wouldnt run 2 well on that
It's supposed to look like a titled smiley.
I always got flamed in IRC channels when I would ask a question in the past for other distros.
because everyone thinks they're so "l33t" to be bothered by "n00bs"...
